Description: Tapestry square applied and sewn to an undyed linen, plain weave textile (open weave/no weft on the back of the square); the tapestry decoration is a bird with a beige, light blue and blue plummage, and beige and pink legs and beak; mauve, purple, beige and pink eye; oriented to the left; in the top right hand corner is a yellow cross within a vegetal and floral wreath/crown; on a purple background; the square is framed by a beige plain band and a red plain band; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/19), weft-undyed linen (S/9); tapestry on single threads: warp-undyed linen (S/10), weft-beige, yellow, pink, mauve, purple, red, light blue, dark blue wool (S/red is 56); oversewing threads in red wool (S); edges all cut and ragged
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
